Articles.Content:
The LT-2 Langing strus legs slide out a bit when you open them. It would be nice if you could individually change how far the extend (default being all the way) in order to compensate a bit for landing on a hillside.

(Perhaps this could be implemented when the tweakables come)

Edited August 31, 2013 by Wice
There was a thread on this and it can be found here. It's been archived though. But yeah, I agree with that.

There was a thread on this and it can be found here. It's been archived though. But yeah, I agree with that.

Well, I'm not talking about shock absorption, I was talking about controlling the matter in which the individual legs extend, in order to level your lander horizontally while standing on a hillside.

Ah, I get what you mean now. Shock absorption is about the same thing though, but with one leg staying in the slightly retracted state after landing. The two suggestions would work well with each other.
I also think those legs need a smoother animation. Right now, extending them on the ground can cause violent flipping (often leading to stuff breaking)
